1.title: Rub My Ed for Luck/Best Ediquette
1.plot: Comedy - Ed & Buddy prepare to host a nut club meeting. After Ed volunteers Buddy to host a very important gathering of the Royal Nut Club, Ed dedicates his best efforts to helping Buddy make a great impression and become a member of the club.

2.title: Crossing Dogs/Squeals on the Bus
2.plot: Comedy - Ed & Buddy take a bus trip to the nut convention. When Ed is temporarily blinded in a toast-related injury, Buddy has no choice but to include Ed in his plans to attend the annual Nut Convention, turning a simple bus trip into an unforgettable ride.

3.title: Smarti Pants/Sock It to Him
3.plot: Comedy - With Buddy sick, Ed must help prepare to host Battle Buddy Weekend. When Buddy is too sick to prepare to host his Battle Buddy Weekend, Ed enlists the aide of a Buddy shaped sock puppet to help him do things right then, to Buddy's dismay, "Sock Buddy" becomes the life of the party.

4.title: Driver's Ed/Go Cart Go
4.plot: Comedy - Ed & Buddy prepare a go cart for the annual race. Buddy wants to win the Swellville go cart competition, but when Ed's help lowers Buddy's chances and improves Mr. Thursty's, a head to head showdown between Team Thursty and Team Buddy ensues.

5.title: Nightmare on Sweet Street/Cat Fright!
5.plot: Comedy - Buddy thinks the Kitten Twins are up to no good. On the eve of Ed and Buddy's birthday, a rash of burglaries in Swellville has Buddy suspecting the Kittens Twins of foul play, and even though Ed believes that the Kittens are innocent, Buddy decides to investigate.

6.title: Ed & Breakfast/Tooth or Consequences
6.plot: Comedy - Buddy's cracked tooth takes both Ed & Buddy to the dentist's office. While showing off his nut cracking abilities, Buddy cracks one of his teeth. At the Dentist's office, Ed volunteers to help out as the dental assistant, but when the dentist leaves, it's up to Ed help to treat Buddy's bad tooth all by himself.

7.title: Lost in Place/Scouts Dishonour
7.plot: Comedy - Buddy joins the Pup Scouts and tries to earn a merit badge. Joining Ed's local Pup Scout troop doesn't really appeal to Buddy. However, when he hears that achieving a merit badge also means a free trip to Nut National Park, Ed does his best to help Buddy earn the vacation.

8.title: Chinese Please/The Unhappy Sandals
8.plot: Comedy - Ed becomes a very different dog after Buddy loses Ed's Happy Sandals. After Buddy takes Ed's Happy Sandals out for a walk then loses them, Ed's happiness fades and he becomes way too serious. With the police on the case and Buddy as their main suspect, Buddy races to help turn Ed back into his old helpful self again.

9.title: Perfect-O/Sleep Wrecker
9.plot: Comedy - Ed tries to help Buddy get some rest before a big day gathering nuts. Tomorrow is the biggest day of the nut-gathering year and, knowing that Buddy needs to get a good night's sleep, Ed does his best to help keep things extra quiet, then winds up keeping Buddy awake all night long.

10.title: The Night Before Hoppenscotch/Yeederhosers
10.plot: Comedy - Ed & Buddy try to instill some holiday spirit into Mr. Thursty. It's Hoppenscotch Eve in Swellville, and in an effort to help Mr. Thursty enjoy the spirit of the season, Ed & Buddy brave the cold and Mr. Thursty's elaborate home security measures in order to sneak a pair of shoes onto his doorstep so that they can be filled with presents.

11.title: My Fair Laddies/Confined to Ed
11.plot: Comedy - Ed & Buddy get sick, and are forced to stay in bed. After Ed & Buddy catch the measles they are ordered to stay in bed, and if being confined to Ed isn't bad enough, Buddy has to rely on Miss Fluffé and the Kitten Twins to nurse them back to health.

12.title: Local Zeroes/Outside Inmates
12.plot: Comedy - Ed & Buddy mistakenly end up in prison. When Ed & Buddy land in prison after being conned by a pair of convicts, Ed decides to devote his time to helping his fellow inmates enjoy their stay, while Buddy is forced into helping Killa the Gorilla escape.

13.title: To Yee or Not to Yee/The Mighty Measle Role
13.plot: Comedy - Ed tries to win a cameo role in his favorite TV show. Ed wants nothing more than to win a walk on role in his favorite TV show, the Mighty Measle Moles, but when Buddy is chosen for the part, it falls to Ed to help prepare Buddy for the Measle Mole role of a lifetime.

14.title: Follow the Yeeder/Come Fly with Yee
14.plot: Comedy - Ed takes an unexpected plane trip with Buddy. Buddy is on his way to judge a nut convention, and Ed comes along for the flight. With no flight attendants on board, Ed takes over as head stewardess, and does his best to help the flight run smoothly.

15.title: Paws for Alarm/Send in the Klownmans
15.plot: Comedy - New neighbors move onto Sweet Street. A family of clowns moves in across the street, much to Ed's delight. Buddy is forced to confront his fear of clowns, and realizes that maybe they aren't so bad after all.

16.title: Chamele-Ed/Camp Camaraderie
16.plot: Comedy - Ed & Buddy travel to a friendship retreat. Ed brings Buddy along to a team building workshop being held at an outdoor recreation centre, and the two work on their friendship by participating in a crazy obstacle course.

17.title: Squirrel's Gone Wild/Ed Waiter
17.plot: Comedy - Ed works as a waiter in a fancy restaurant. Ed's attempt to prepare dinner for Buddy fails, and the two decide to go out to eat. When the waiter at the fancy restaurant Ed & Buddy are dining at gets fired, Ed decides to step in and help out by becoming the new head waiter.

18.title: Missing Mittens Mission/Talking Ed
18.plot: Comedy - Buddy enters a talent competition hosted by his childhood hero. Buddy's lifelong dream of participating in a variety telethon is hindered by his lack of talent. When Ed decides to help out by teaching Buddy to be a ventriloquist, Ed's teaching skills leave a bit to be desired.

19.title: Lost Ed Found/Peddle Me Nuts
19.plot: Comedy - Buddy raises money for charity by riding a unicycle. In an attempt to raise money for a children's charity, Buddy must learn to ride a unicycle. When his early attempts prove unsuccessful, Ed offers to coach him using his superior unicycling skills.

20.title: Aye Robots/Where No Buddy Has Gone Before
20.plot: Comedy - Buddy makes a new friend at a TV convention. When the Mighty Measle Mole convention comes to town, Ed drags Buddy along with him. Buddy is then introduced to the beautiful Bonnie, and does everything in his power to impress the gorgeous squirrel.

21.title: Uncommon Scents/A Pox on Thee Now
21.plot: Comedy - Miss Fluffe tries to put a curse on Buddy, and Ed wants to help get it removed. When Miss Fluffe decides that Buddy is too much of a fuddy duddy, she places a curse on him. While Buddy couldn't care less, Ed decides he must to everything in his power to help get it removed.

22.title: No Buddy's Hero/An Arm Yee of One
22.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

23.title: Memor-Yee Loss/Long Bark of the Law
23.plot: Comedy - Ed has the law on his tail, and Buddy urges him to run. After Ed accidentally removes an important piece of furniture from a local business, Sergeant Jo Jo shows up at his door. Buddy is convinced that Ed is under arrest, and convinces him to run away from Jo Jo as fast as he can.

24.title: King Tut Tut's Nut/Gym Dandy!
24.plot: Comedy - Ed helps buddy prepare for an important test. Buddy receives notice in the mail that he is eligible to join the prestigious 'Royal Nut Club', on the condition that he pass a physical test. Ed decides that he will do his very best to help Buddy prepare for the test, however Ed goes a bit too far, and offers slightly too much help.

25.title: Ed for Sale/Rope-A-Dopes
25.plot: Comedy - Ed & Buddy enter a wrestling competition. To prove to Mr. Thursty that he is tough enough, Buddy joins Ed in the Swellville Tag Team Wrestle Off. When Ed & Buddy unexpectedly make it all the way to the final match, they must face the toughest team of all - The Raging Bulls!

26.title: Help Want-Ed/Screaming Yee-Bees
26.plot: Comedy - Ed is diagnosed with a horrible sleeping sickness, Dr. Quacken recruits Buddy's help. Buddy must keep Ed awake for 24 hours, to prevent the return of the illness - but Buddy cannot tell Ed why they must stay awake. Buddy tells Ed that they are trying to break the 'Stay Awake Record', and then proceeds to take him on an all night, cross town adventure.

imdb.plot outline: Best Ed is about the unlikely friendship between a dog named Ed and a squirrel named Buddy. Ed wakes up every morning to be the best Ed he can be, even though it drives Buddy bonkers. But for every funny blunder Buddy suffers, thanks to Ed's cloying good deeds, Buddy knows that...although it's hard to live with Ed...it's harder to live without him. Meet the new odd couple for kids...one best Buddy.
imdb.title: Best Ed

production companies.name: Bell Broadcast and New Media Fund

plot: _Best Ed_ (qv) is about the unlikely friendship between a dog named Ed and a squirrel named Buddy. Ed wakes up every morning to be the best Ed he can be, even though it drives Buddy bonkers. But for every funny blunder Buddy suffers, thanks to Ed's cloying good deeds, Buddy knows that...although it's hard to live with Ed...it's harder to live without him. Meet the new odd couple for kids...one best Buddy.
